trans-unit.source:
\n

Represents calling a constructor and initializing one or more members of the new object.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx x xxxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxx xx xxxx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the bindings that describe how to initialize the members of the newly created object.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxx xxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets a value that indicates whether the expression tree node can be reduced.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx x xxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxx xxx xx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

True if the node can be reduced, otherwise false.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xx xxx xxxx xxx xx xxxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the expression that represents the constructor call.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Creates a new expression that is like this one, but using the supplied children.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx x xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xx xxxx xxxx xxx$ xxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
If all of the children are the same, it will return this expression.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xx xxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxx xxxx$ xx xxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

This expression if no children are changed or an expression with the updated children.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx xx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xx xx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x
